author: Gabriel Vilches

text: It just occurred to me that your Best VGM list is actually the reason why I got into Persona and Shin Megami Tensei in the first place. It was years ago when I heard "Battle for Everyone's Souls" on your channel, and that song alone made me fall in love with the series. I didn't play the series until many years after I heard that song for the first time, but I'm absolutely in love with all the games now. Thank you very much for these uploads, and thank you for introducing me to a game series that has changed my life for the better in many ways. Keep being awesome.

author: Blue Toad

text: just as i read this comment, i started hearing them
author: Ren Shinomiya

text: What do you mean, reversed notes? I’m asking as someone with no music knowledge?
author: TwoKool115

text: @TwoKool115 I'm not a music person either, so it's not a technical term as far as I know.  In context though, I meant literally that the notes were recorded and then the recording played backwards for the final piece. Because notes (and most noises) are made by a strong initial impact and then reverberate from there until they fade out, reversed recordings have a distinctive "shwwwp" sound to them, as they fade in and suddenly stop.  Listen around 4:13
author: PsychadelicoDuck

text: PsychadelicoDuck oh, that’s what those were. I was honestly curious about those. Thanks Man.
author: TwoKool115

text: Which game do you think I should start with?  Is it better that i play/watch them in numerical order?  I own a PS2, but i need to get some replacement controllers.
author: Eric C.

text: 3 and 4 are standalone games for the most part, so you don't need to go in order. 4 has a passing reference to 3, but it's nothing major. As for which one... I'd say 4 is better gameplay wise, because it lets you command your teammates directly instead of the AI controlling them like in 3.
author: JessePrower

text: Do you have a PS3 by any chance? Persona 3 and Persona 4 are also available on the PSN there as well.
author: TheGrottoMotto

text: If you only have a PS2, you should try Persona 3 FES and Persona 4. They're both pretty good.
author: Hawlo

text: 3. It doesn't really matter which one you start with because unlike other JRPGs like Kingdom Hearts and Xenosaga you don't need to play one to understand the other. I just said 3 because it's my personal favorite.
author: Lotte Yanson

text:
simple.
You want the best gameplay : Persona 4
You want a better story, characters and arguably music: Persona 3 FES/ Portable

It's almost factual, not even a matter of opinion.

text: A Persona spin-off for the 3DS, it's only been released in Japan so far but I've heard great things about it. The soundtrack is just as big as a mainline title and seems to be full of quality tracks from Meguro & Co. This particularly lenghty theme was composed by Toshiki Konishi... lengthy in a good way, especially when it plays in what I'll assume is a major (final?) dungeon, preventing it from feeling too repetitive after a lot of time spent running around. I'm a big fan of the chants during the segment 2+ minutes in.
author: SupraDarky

text: I was about to say this is a really freaking long track. But it only makes me more excited for the game. I'm definitely gonna pick it up.

text: I have not played a game from the Persona series, but I am really interested in getting this game.  I may try to get it at Toys R Us when they do a sale for buy one game and get another half off (I don't think it's half off, but it's in the ballpark).  I am really enjoying this song a lot.  Nice and varied, which is a good thing for long themes.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. I think you'll enjoy this a lot more if you familiarize yourself with Persona 3 and 4. I'm not saying you should play them, but try to learn the basic plot behind each game, so you can understand better when does this one take place.
author: Hawlo

text:
@Eric C.
playing Persona Q before persona 3 and 4 is a silly/nonsensical mistake. This is a game for the fans.  Stop and go play persona 3 and 4
author: heyjeySigma

text: @heyjeySigma Have you even played the game? Like, I have heard a lot of reviewers and just people in general saying that playing P3 and P4 before isn't really that important.
author: Atay

text: @Dangan Fan It's not as it doesn't reveal major plot points from either game (only assuming), but someone who's familiar with the cast and what they've been up to might enjoy the game a lot more than someone who's visiting this world for the first time.
author: Hawlo

text:
@Dangan Fan you like danganronpa huh.. well then, think of it like playing danganronpa 2 without playing danganronpa 1.  Sure you can, but is it recommended? NO.

now take the same concept with persona Q
author: heyjeySigma

text: @heyjeySigma I like Dangan Ronpa, too, but it's not the same. DR2 is a direct sequel, but PQ is a spin-off story that takes place in the middle of each of the game's plot. It happens right before each game's major plot points.
author: Hawlo
Atay

text:
@Dangan Fan fair enough, i stand corrected.

But you'll be missing out on character backgrounds and everything if you never played P3 and 4, that's all.  The choice is yours of course. I just wouldnt recommend it
